titleStmt.title: Reference list of locations in Ottoman Syria

publicationStmt.p: The file was originally created in November 2012 and is continuously updated through manual and automated input by the original author.

place.note: Sūq al-Ḥamīdiyya was originally only the new Sūq cut through the built-up area between the Sūq al-Jadīd / al-Arwām in the West and Sūq Bāb al-Barīd in the East

place.desc: This is the actual minarett, belonging to the later Mosque al-Ḥubūbī

place.note: location of a railway station on the Damascus-Beirut line. origin of the line to Birecik and Hama

projectDesc.p: The TEI file was produced by Till Grallert to provide a list of geo-tagged toponyms extracted from a database of sources (Sente XML) and enriched with geo information from geonames.org

editorialDecl.p: The relation between places, toponyms and their geographic location was recorded using TEI P5 XML. Individual <place> nodes are nested inside <listPlace> nodes following administrative and topographic structures. Thus the quarters of the city of Damascus are recorded as <place> nodes nested inside a <listPlace> that corresponds to the city. The city of Damascus is then part of a <listPlace> for the county, the district, and the province. Future improvements could record different sets of relations in parallel <listPlace> nodes that all link to a flat tree of places.
The transscription of Arabic and Ottoman toponyms follows the IJMES paradigm.

According to TEI P5 @xml:lang should follow BCP 47 , which specifies for Arabic in Latin transcription "ar-Latn". The specific type of transcription should be added as a private use subtag, i.e. "ar-Latn-x-ijmes" for the IJMES transcription of Arabic in Latin script. The tag for Ottoman Turkish is "ota". For transcription in Latin script following an adapted IJMES transcription, it would be "ota-Latn-x-ijmes". The English variant of Latinised Arabic would be "ar-Latn-EN" and the French "ar-Latn-FR"
the structur of the element geo is lat, long

The pattern of xml:ids is the following: - no xml:id: no reference to this place could be found in online databases - xml:id starting with lgn [location geonames] refer to geoname.org/xml:id - xml:id starting with lwm [location wikimapia] refer to wikimapia.org/xml:id - in case of Ottoman provinces named after their capital cities, a "p" is amended to the end of the xml:id.

revisionDesc.change: created a hierarchy of quarters and neighbourhoods in Damascus
expanded the project description and editorial declarations
